title: The Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 brings Wi-Fi 7, sticks with some 32-bit support
description: Features 32-bit support, Wi-Fi 7, the AV1 codec, and hardware ray tracing.

title: This modded Game Boy Pocket goes against nature by folding in half
description: No, it's not a Game Boy Advance SP. This is the monochrome Pocket with hinge.

title: Study: Ötzi the Iceman probably thawed and refroze several times
description: This would increase the odds of finding another prehistoric human body in melting ice.

title: Right-wing doctor group led by anti-vaccine insurrectionist implodes in scandal
description: Simone Gold used charity funds to buy $3.6M house, group leaders claim.

title: Apple’s satellite emergency service launches in the US and Canada
description: It'll come to France, Germany, Ireland, and the UK in December.

title: State-sponsored hackers in China compromise certificate authority
description: Active in dozens of advanced hacks since 2009, Billbug is still going strong.

title: Is tonight the night that NASA’s massive SLS rocket finally takes flight?
description: "We are going," NASA says. "We sure hope so," America replies.

title: This year’s ugly Microsoft sweater has a suggestion for you: It’s Clippy
description: Past years' sweater themes have included Minesweeper and Windows XP.

title: Judge drops DMCA claims that Bungie reverse-engineered Destiny 2 cheats
description: If you're going to reverse-sue under DMCA and CFAA, you'd better prove it.

title: Epic strikes back at Apple’s iOS “security” defense in appeals court
description: Is the iOS "walled garden" a security feature, or just an "excuse" to rake in profits?

title: Musk ignored Twitter staff’s warning that scammers would abuse paid verification
description: "Motivated scammers/bad actors could be willing to pay," internal report warned.

title: Lucid reveals its next electric vehicle, the Gravity SUV
description: Lucid is the latest automaker to show off an electric three-row SUV.

title: Musk fires Twitter engineers for correcting, criticizing him on Twitter, Slack
description: As many as 14 Twitter employees fired for tweets, Slack messages.

title: Callisto Protocol shows how audio design elevates a game from scary to terrifying
description: In part 2 of our exclusive four-part preview, hear about the sounds & music of horror.

title: Researchers break security guarantees of TTE networking used in spacecraft
description: Used by NASA and many others, time-triggered Ethernet safety can be compromised.

title: Global investigators pounce as FTX collapse leaves up to 1 million creditors
description: Regulators around the world have "substantial interest" after crypto group’s demise.

title: “Project Volterra” review: Microsoft’s $600 Arm PC that almost doesn’t suck
description: There's a reason it isn't a Surface PC, but it's good for its intended purpose.
